resources.string:
Mirakel is easy to use (We hope so). You have three main screens:
* The list of your lists (left side) * The tasks in the current list (center) * The detailed view of the current task (right side)
You can switch between the screens by swiping to the right or the left. To open the Lists-Screen you can swipe from the left edge of the device or tap the Mirakel-logo in the Action Bar.

The Meta lists are lists, where you can not store tasks, but you can define, which tasks should be shown if you open this list. To **configure** this open `Settings→Manage meta lists`. There you can create new lists or change the properties of the old ones.
#### HowTo For example, you want to create a list `Next two weeks`, where you want to show all tasks you have to do in the next two weeks.
1. Go to `Settings→Manage meta lists` 2. Tap on the `+`-Button (or open the menu point to add a special list) 3. Set the name to `Next two weeks` 4. The the `Due` to `+14 Days` 5. You\'re ready. But you can configure a lot more things here.

The task templates can speed up your daily use of Mirakel. For example you can create a new Task called `Today plan project` and Mirakel create then a Task `plan project` with the current date as the due date.
You can also combine the conditions. But consider that your conditions must be the first words of a task and a condition can only be one word.
For example I also use the following condition: `Mirakel today fix that bug` This creates me a new Task in the list `NA: Mirakel` (first condition) and set the due date to today (second condition)
#### Please note:
* The last condition overrides the previous conditions if they do the same action. (If you create a Task `Today Tomorrow Foo`, then the due-date will be tomorrow) * The task templates are stronger then the SpecialLists.
#### HowTo You want to create a condition `Mirakel` to put the task in the list `NA: Mirakel`
1. Go to `Settings→Tasks` 2. Activate the `Task templates` 3. Go to `Configure Task templates` 2. Tap on the `+`-button (or open the menu point to add a special list) 5. Set the condition to `Mirakel` (It\'s case insensitive) 6. Tap `Set List` and select the list `NA: Mirakel` (or the list you want)

Subtasks are a nice way to better organize your tasks. You can create for example a new Task `shopping` and create subtasks for every item you want to buy.
#### Please note: * The Subtasks are stored in a List. So if you don\'t want to see the subtasks anywhere, create a new List `Subtasks` and Configure the Subtasks so they would be saved to this list: `Settings→Tasks→Add Subtask to the list of Task` (There you can select the default list) * You can also add normal tasks to a Task as a subtask. * A Task can be a subtask of many tasks * If you mark a parent task as `done` all subtasks will be marked as `done`

You can sync your tasks with [Taskwarrior](http://taskwarrior.org/projects/show/taskwarrior).
This is the **preferred** (and best tested) way of syncing your tasks. If you want to setup your own server, read [this tutorial](/taskwarrior.html).
##### Please note: * You can not sync your files with Taskwarrior

#### CalDAV-Sync For the CalDAV Sync you need an app which supports the synchronisation with Mirakel. We use [DAVdroid](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=at.bitfire.davdroid) ([F-Droid](https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdid=at.bitfire.davdroid)). Currently you have to install our modified version of DAVdroid: http://mirakel.azapps.de/davdroid.apk

Easy task management for professionals!
Please do not report bugs in the comments! Send us an email to mirakel@azapps.de or open an issue on our github page: https://github.com/azapps/mirakel-android/
We want to manage our tasks with a simple, powerful tool! We love free, open source software! We want to keep our data under control!
How about you?
Features
• Manage your tasks in lists • Simple, but powerful User Interface • Tablet-UI • Nice scaleable widget • Sort your tasks in different ways • Fully configurable • Notifications & Reminders • Easy Backup and Import • Import your tasks from Astrid • Sync the lists with your own (or the official) server (→Experimental!)
We love to implement new features! You\'ve got an idea? Get in touch with us!
If you find a Bug, please create an issue on our Github-page or write us an e-mail. https://github.com/azapps/mirakel-android/
